verb.description: Gently calm (a person or their feelings)
examples: a shot of brandy might soothe his nerves

origin: Old English sōthian verify, show to be true, from sōth true (see sooth). In the 16th century the verb passed through the senses corroborate (a statement), humor (a person) by expressing assent and flatter by one's assent, whence mollify, appease (late 17th century).
